item.itunes:title: 267: Why You Aren't Living Your Dharma Yet with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Another real one! As I’m writing my book Discover Your Dharma I’m speaking to more and more people who are on the quest of discovering your dharma and going back into my own mindset when I was discovering my own, which was reminded me of the many fears and limiting beliefs we carry that are withholding us from operating at our maximum truth and highest frequency. In this episode, I discuss why you aren’t living your dharma yet and how to get started on the journey.

Ready to work with me on a deeper level to create your conscious empire? Sahara no longer facilitates this mastermind but instead created the Dharma Coaching Institute to train people to become Certified Dharma Coaches. Find out more at iamsahararose.com

item.itunes:title: 264: How to Unleash Yourself with Yarixa Ferrao
item.description:
Our bodies hold the codes to our greatest awakening. Spirituality is not about leaving the body but about being fully immersed in it. I sit down for this fun and informative episode with my friend Yarixa, founder of Unleash Movement, to discuss the healing power of dance and the importance of embodiment.

item.description:
I’m not here to be a part of the old narrative. And neither are you. In this episode, I talk about my purpose, what I’m here to create and why I’m not here to make anyone feel comfortable. And expanding our definition of what FUN and WERK mean.

item.title: 250: The Roots of Tantra with Chandresh Bhardwaj
item.itunes:title: 250: The Roots of Tantra with Chandresh Bhardwaj
item.description:
As interest in Tantra increases, it’s important we know the roots of this ancient science and there is no better person to learn from than 7th generation Tantra guru Chandresh Bhardwaj. In this in-depth episode, we go into the history of Tantra, Tantric meditation, why you should not meditate to the mantra “om” or “shring”, the Goddess Kali and more. If you’re interested in the Vedas, yoga and spirituality, you’re going to LOVE this episode!

Connect with Chandresh @cbmeditates

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 249: The Power of Sisterhood with Stacey Hickman
item.itunes:title: 249: The Power of Sisterhood with Stacey Hickman
item.description:
Stacey signed up for the #RoseGoldGoddessChallenge and it ended up changing the trajectory of her entire life! In this episode, we discuss the power of female friendships, why one woman winning doesn’t make another losing, the scars many of us have from female friendships, the effect Rose Gold Goddesses has had on Stacey’s life and why it’s so important to take the leap.

Doors are opening back up for ONE week only to join our sisterhood! Head over to RoseGoldGoddesses.com to participate in our free challenge and join now.. It just may change your life!

item.itunes:title: 232: How To Build Relationships with Anyone (Including the Dalai Lama) with Michael Trainer
item.description:
We all know the power of connections but it can be hard to create them! Michael Trainer, co-founder of Global Citizen Fest, shares how his people skills and spiritual commitment has led to him interviewing people like Dalai Lama and of course founding the Global Citizen Fest which has had singers like Beyonce perform. We also discuss the power of meditation for brain-health and his commitment to teaching meditation through his organization Peak Mind after his father got Alzheimer’s.

item.title: 217: Past Life Regression Therapy with Jeroen de Wit
item.itunes:title: 217: Past Life Regression Therapy with Jeroen de Wit
item.description:
Have you ever wondered what you were in your past life, how many past lives you’ve had, how to even know if you’ve had one, if we all experience them the same way, which are literal and which are figurative? We discuss it all in this episode.

I had the pleasure of undergoing a past life regression with Jeroen the week prior to this interview and we discuss what I experienced as an elf, figure skater, lionness and much more!

Jeroen is most known for being the regressionist in the book “The Boy Who Knew Too Much” about the boy who remembered his entire life as Babe Ruth!

Check him out and book a session with him at www.jeroenqhht.com/

Try Vahdam Teas chai sampler by heading over to https://www.vahdamteas.com/collections/sahara-rose and use coupon code "sahara" for 20% off

In this episode, we discuss the writing process, Vipassana (silent meditations), coming to your own truth, the meaning of life and how to actualize our purpose. item.title: 213: Living Life By Your Own Rules with Amy Jo Martin
item.itunes:title: 213: Living Life By Your Own Rules with Amy Jo Martin
item.description:
There is no one version of success-- it may be writing a NYT best-selling book, it may be quitting your job and moving into the forest, it may be working with Shaq or it may be selling all your belongings and living on a boat. Amy Jo Martin has experienced all four. In this episode, we discuss the importance of listening to your heart, having a meditation practice and knowing WHY you are choosing the life you live-- and how your reality is a result of your DECISION!

Check out Amy Jo Martin’s work at AmyJoMartin.com @AmyJoMartin.

item.itunes:title: 207: Human Design - Exploring How You Were Meant To Operate with Erin Claire
item.description:
Finding out I was a Projector was a game-changer for me. Everything made sense-- the way I channel ideas, how I can see the big picture, and why I KNOW I get burnt out doing all the things and have to force myself to just focus on one thing at a time! In this episode, we explore the four Human Design archetypes (Projector, Generator, Manifestor and Reflector) and what that means for each of us!

item.title: 195: Overcoming Your Quarter-Life Crisis with Christine Hassler
item.itunes:title: 195: Overcoming Your Quarter-Life Crisis with Christine Hassler
item.description:
Oh the quarter-life crisis.. Who’s had one? Anyone? If you’re a millennial, most likely. In this episode, we discuss why it’s okay not to have your shit figured out in your 20’s and how much you mentally and spiritually develop in these years in your life, which is why you may feel crazy to totally switch your mind about things. If you’re dealing with your quarter-life crisis or know someone who is, you’ll want ot listen to this impactful interview with transformational life coach Christine Hassler!

item.title: 185: Overcoming Anxiety with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 185: Overcoming Anxiety with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Anxiety is a major issue with today's world and in this episode, I explain why it is related to our global Vata imbalance and what to do about it. I also share how not all anxiety is a "bad" thing and sometimes it can actually be warning us about a change we need to make in our lives. The trick is to not let it linger as anxiety but use it as an active measurement. Whether you suffer from anxiety or simply just overthink a lot (who doesn't?!) you'll find value in this episode.

item.title: 177: Finding Your Voice + True Self with Seal
item.itunes:title: 177: Finding Your Voice + True Self with Seal
item.description:
Seal has the second most played song in American history, Kissed From a Rose (remember from the 90’s Batman movie?) Well he is so much more than just an accomplished singer. In this episode, we discuss his incredible journey from foster-care and homelessness to Grammy-winning singer; his view on past-lives; his mantra album (it’s amazing); his spiritual practice and advice he would have had for his 20-year-old self.

Seal also has a new album dropping soon, which I got the opportunity to listen to, that merges spirituality with feel-good dance music!

Check out his work on Spotify @Seal, Instagram @Seal and Seal.com

item.title: 174: Food Lies and Reclaiming Health with Vani Hari
item.itunes:title: 174: Food Lies and Reclaiming Health with Vani Hari
item.description:
From the incredible woman who got Starbucks to remove their yoga mat material from their bread, Starbucks to remove artificial ingredients from their Pumpkin Spice Lattes and Girl Scouts to make non-GMO cookies, Vani Hari aka Food Babe is here to spread the truth about the food industry. In this episode, we discuss the false information we are being told by the packaged/ fast food industry and how we can become more aware consumers.

I highly recommend checking out her new book “Feeding You Lies: How to Unravel the Food Industry's Playbook and Reclaim Your Health” to dive in deeper into her work.

Check out her Instagram @thefoodbabe and website foodbabe.com

item.title: 173: Overcoming Spiritual Comparison with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 173: Overcoming Spiritual Comparison with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Just like we once compared bodies, bank accounts and relationships, people are now comparing their spiritual journeys. “Sally can talk to animals, Cindy can channel the Pleidians, Monica can speak in light language, Rebecca can perform distance reiki.. I must not be as wise as them,” we think.

This episode is about how pointless and counteractive it is to compare our spiritual journeys with others because they are inherently unique.. And yours is directly related to YOUR dharma

Dive into my world of plant-based, modern Ayurveda with my best-selling book Eat Feel Fresh: A Contemporary Plant-Based Ayurvedic Cookbook, with over 500 5-star reviews on Amazon! item.title: 172: From Housewife to Co-Founder of a Billion Dollar Company with Lisa Bilyeu
item.itunes:title: 172: From Housewife to Co-Founder of a Billion Dollar Company with Lisa Bilyeu
item.description:
Ever wondered what it’s like going from making protein bars for your husband before he goes to work to co-founding the largest protein bar company in the world? Now ever wondered if your digestive health suffered so deeply that you weren’t even able to eat those bars anymore, nor work at the company you helped grow? Find out with one of the realest, funniest women I know, Lisa Bilyeu.

Connect with Lisa @LisaBilyeu and check out her Women of Impact show on Youtube (where I was interviewed on the episode on Identity in January!)

item.title: 170: Discussing Open Relationships with Aubrey Marcus
item.itunes:title: 170: Discussing Open Relationships with Aubrey Marcus
item.description:
This episode was triggering for me and I’m SO glad I had it! Aubrey, NYT best-selling author, is in a very public open-relationship with his fiancé Whitney and is courageous enough to share it with all of us. In this episode we discuss his new book, daily routine what I believe his Dosha is (can you guess) and of course—his open relationship.

I asked him questions that were on my mind, such as “Who’s idea was it? Are your other partners mutual friends? Is it a don’t ask, don’t’ tell policy? What are you going to do when you have kids? What if you both fall in love with someone else?” and he answered from a grounded, mature and wise place. It really opened my mind to see someone so vocal and comfortable about the uncertainty of his relationship and though polyamory is NOT for me, it definitely allowed me to understand the perspective much better.

Connect with Aubrey at @aubreymarcus aubreymarcus.com and check out his new book “Own the Day.”

item.title: 165: How To Handle Being an Empath with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 165: How To Handle Being an Empath with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Do you feel sadness in your heart when you see a child crying, a homeless person or an abandoned puppy? That makes you an empath-- and a human. In this episode, I share my opinion that we are ALL empaths, not just some of us, and the closing of our hearts is what has led to us feeling lonely, disconnected and isolated. Tune in.

Dive into my world of plant-based, modern Ayurveda with my best-selling book Eat Feel Fresh: A Contemporary Plant-Based Ayurvedic Cookbook, with over 500 5-star reviews on Amazon! This is your ultimate guide to Ayurveda, chakras and all holistic Vedic healing, in an approachable, affordable and delicious way! Get it for $100 off at: https://www.amazon.com/Eat-Feel-Fresh-Contemporary-Plant-Based/dp/1465475621/
Also available at Barnes + Nobles and wherever books are sold

Do you feel sadness in your heart when you see a child crying, a homeless person or an abandoned puppy? That makes you an empath-- and a human. In this episode, I share my opinion that we are ALL empaths, not just some of us, and the closing of our hearts is what has led to us feeling lonely, disconnected and isolated. Tune in.

item.itunes:title: 164: My First Song: Thoughts On Time-Produced by Cosmic Quest
item.description:
I am so excited and nervous to share with you my first ever song, Thoughts on Time, produced by Cosmic Quest. This song is a poem that I wrote in Bali about the my thoughts of time-- does it truly exist or is it just a fabrication of the human mind? item.description:
Tinctures, elixirs and tonics-- oh my! The world is herbology is vast full of information and sometimes it can be hard to really understand these plants! I sit down with expert Teana David, student of the Wise Woman Tradition, to really get to know these medicinal herbs and how to use them in a way that works with our 21st century schedules. She is also the director of Deepak Homebase, where I had my book launch this fall!

item.itunes:title: 159: Neurolinguistic Programming (NLP) 101 with Ruben Mata
item.description:

item.title: 158: 28 Lessons I’ve Learned In My 28 Years—Part 2 with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 158: 28 Lessons I’ve Learned In My 28 Years—Part 2 with Sahara Rose
item.description:
This has now become an annual tradition and I hope to continue sharing the lessons I’ve learned each year on my birthday for all my years to come.

This year has really been my emergence- the butterfly spreading its wings.

I got engaged, launched Eat Feel Fresh as the #1 best-selling Ayurveda book (which took the spot of Idiots Guide to Ayurveda), public spoke in front of thousands of people, hosted a sold-out book tour in four cities, launched my Eat Right For Your Mind-Body Type, Doshas + Dharma, Awaken Your Powers, Abundance Mindset Masterclass/Program and Sex Money Magic programs, wrote my next book and another secret project, recorded over 150 podcast episodes, was interviewed on hundreds of others, launched my tanktop line, did a Panchakarma, started my doTERRA Path to Freedom biz/tribe, was featured in Yoga Journal, Vogue + Forbes, went back to Bali, recorded my first song + started to learn how to DJ. Let’s just say it was a year of PITTA.

I learned a lot about my limits, boundaries, dedication, tribe and what truly matters. This episode is all about my lessons—and what’s next.

Dive into my world of plant-based, modern Ayurveda with my best-selling book Eat Feel Fresh: A Contemporary Plant-Based Ayurvedic Cookbook, with over 500 5-star reviews on Amazon! This is your ultimate guide to Ayurveda, chakras and all holistic Vedic healing, in an approachable, affordable and delicious way! Get it for $100 off at: https://www.amazon.com/Eat-Feel-Fresh-Contemporary-Plant-Based/dp/1465475621/
Also available at Barnes + Nobles and wherever books are sold

Get your questions answered by me each week in my new Youtube show, Ask Sahara. From “what is my purpose” to “what do I do if I’m a cross between two Doshas” to “how do I manifest the one?” I’ve got your most pressing questions answered. Subscribe at youtube.com/sahara.

Take advantage of this month's Care-Of New Year's special and receive 50% off your first month of supplements by heading over to takecareof.com and enter code HIGHESTSELF50 for 50% off your supplements

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 156: Social Media and Vulnerability with Yoga Girl Rachel Brathen
item.itunes:title: 156: Social Media and Vulnerability with Yoga Girl Rachel Brathen
item.description:
Do you ever get vulnerability hangovers when you share something that feels like it was “too much” on social media? @Yoga_Girl doesn’t. With over 2 million followers on Instagram, she shares how she ditched sharing yoga poses for sharing what is really going on in her life-- the imperfect truth. From precious moments with her daughter to feeling anger with the child abuse on Aruba, Rachel shares truly from the heart.

I dive into the lifestyle, food, exercise, self-care and habitual suggestions for each Dosha in my modern Ayurvedic approach. item.description:
What is this “new paradigm”, “great awakening” and “transition between 3d to 5d consciousness” people keep talking about? And what does this mean for us? I break it down in this episode and explain what you can expect in this shift.

Get your questions answered by me each week in my new Youtube show, Ask Sahara. From “what is my purpose” to “what do I do if I’m a cross between two Doshas” to “how do I manifest the one?” I’ve got your most pressing questions answered. Subscribe at youtube.com/sahara.

Dive into my world of plant-based, modern Ayurveda with my best-selling book Eat Feel Fresh: A Contemporary Plant-Based Ayurvedic Cookbook, with over 500 5-star reviews on Amazon! This is your ultimate guide to Ayurveda, chakras and all holistic Vedic healing, in an approachable, affordable and delicious way! Get it for $100 off at: https://www.amazon.com/Eat-Feel-Fresh-Contemporary-Plant-Based/dp/1465475621/
Also available at Barnes + Nobles and wherever books are sold

Want to know what it takes to be a great speaker? Alexi is your girl. She and husband Preston Smiles (and now baby Kingston Ra) travel around the world speaking and empowering crowds to become their best selves. In this episode we discuss her journey from Ja Rule’s back-up dancer (for real) to TV host to prominent speaker to mother, and why she has decided her keep her motherhood journey private.

The program is 100% online and part-time so you’ll be able to make the transition into your new Holistic career while still keeping your current!

The program is split between 6 months of nutrition theory (think HUNDREDS of dietary theories and coaching methods)

item.itunes:title: 142: Food Emotionality with Samantha Skelley
item.description:
What does your eating say about your emotions? Everything! In this episode, Hungry for Happiness founder Samantha Skelley and I dive into the concept of food emotionality. We discuss how various eating disorders are related to specific emotions, and how self-awareness can help us move forward.

Become a Food Emotionality Coach at Hungry for Happiness and create a thriving career helping others have a healthier, more balanced relationship with food! You will be trained how to stop using food as a drug and how to finally love your body, then how to teach others to do the same! The world is calling out for more leaders to rise up so if you’re looking to work in this cross between health and life coaching, this is for you!

Receive a $1000 discount, as well as my Eat Right For Your Mind-Body Type Modern Ayurveda Program FREE, by heading over to hungryforhappiness.com/sahara and using code “sahara” when you register.

Become a Food Emotionality Coach at Hungry for Happiness and create a thriving career helping others have a healthier, more balanced relationship with food! You will be trained how to stop using food as a drug and how to finally love your body, then how to teach others to do the same! The world is calling out for more leaders to rise up so if you’re looking to work in this cross between health and life coaching, this is for you!

Receive a $1000 discount, as well as my Eat Right For Your Mind-Body Type Modern Ayurveda Program FREE, by heading over to hungryforhappiness.com/sahara and using code “sahara” when you register.

item.title: 141: The World's Major Pitta Imbalance with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 141: The World's Major Pitta Imbalance with Sahara Rose
item.description:
The wars, the fires, the gun violence. The world is dealing with a major Pitta (fire) imbalance.
The inflammation within us has created inflammation in society.

As is the macrocosm, so is the microcosm.

What is going on in the global sphere is a reflection of what is happening in the internal sphere.

The anger, duality and aggression within ourselves has manifested into those Pitta qualities in the global compass.

And that means we can do something about it.

Ask yourself:
1. Where am I still holding onto anger?
2. How am I judging others?
3. How can I show more patience?
4. Who do I need to forgive?
5. How can I be more of service?
.
Focus on eating cooling foods, particularly leafy greens + coconuts.

We must all stay away from spicy food, coffee and excess garlic, all which trigger a Pitta imbalance (I share over 100+ things you SHOULD eat instead in my new book #EatFeelFresh and my book The Idiots Guide to Ayurveda has over 300 pages on how to balance your Dosha )

When you heal yourself, you heal the planet.
This is the biggest act of activism you can commit.

Let's reduce the fires, in ourselves, in our communities, in our societies.

And let the world come back into balance again.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 140: Become Your Own Best Doctor with Dr. Jessica Peatross
item.itunes:title: 140: Become Your Own Best Doctor with Dr. Jessica Peatross
item.description:
I’ve known Dr. Jess for over four years now, we co-hosted the East Meets West Retreat and are now in business together in the Path to Freedom Program! I am SO excited to have her here on the Highest Self Podcast talking all about gut health, mold, lyme, candida, autoimmune disease and so much more. She is my go-to for all things health and I’m so honored to share her with you.

Get mentored by Dr. Jess + I (as well as Melissa Ambrosini, Alyson Charles, Tara Mackey and other podcast guests) in the Path to Freedom Program. We teach you step-by-step on how to create a thriving business with DoTerra essential oils.
Begin your adventure at iamsahararose.com/freedom

Dr. Jess (Dr.Jessica Peatross) is a western trained medical doctor who began her journey into healing in 2009 when she graduated from the University of Louisville internal medicine residency program. She later had a Kundalini awakening, which prompted her to dive into Eastern and holistic health. She is passionate about teaching people how to be their own best doctor by educating themselves and listening to their body.

item.description:
How do you keep the FIRE (Pitta) up when you’re starting to feel like roommates? I explore this in this episode, as I prepare for my wedding next summer (and definitely want to keep the fire going for the LONG run!) Is it possible? Let’s discuss!

For more on this topic, check out Esther Perel’s Mating in Captivity.

item.title: 136: Work-Life Balance with Melissa Ambrosini + Nick Broadhurst
item.itunes:title: 136: Work-Life Balance with Melissa Ambrosini + Nick Broadhurst
item.description:
While dancing on the beach, I was reminded how important work-life balance is. In this world of social media, it can be a very difficult thing to maintain. I sat down with my dear friends Melissa Ambrosini + Nick Broadhurst to discuss how this married, business-partner duo manages work/life balance.. And their tips are SO inspiring.

Get mentored by Nick, Melissa and I in the Path to Freedom Program. We teach you step-by-step on how to create a thriving business with DoTerra essential oils.

Begin your adventure at iamsahararose.com/freedom

Melissa Ambrosini is the bestselling author of Mastering Your Mean Girl, host of 'The Melissa Ambrosini Show' podcast, a motivational speaker, an entrepreneur and self-love teacher.

Nick Broadhurst is a singer/ songwriter/ film producer/ podcast host and meditation and Ayurveda advocate. Together they co-founded the Path to Freedom Program.

Join our team at iamsahararose.com/freedom

item.itunes:title: 130: How To Make Six Figures Teaching Yoga with Brett Larkin
item.description:
YES it is possible to do what you love (including teach yoga) and create abundance and this episode is just about that! I sit down with my dear friend Brett Larkin again to share the many avenues a yoga teacher can take to monetize their business.

Brett is the founder of Uplifted Yoga, an online yoga and meditation community empowering students to personalize their practice and ignite their best life - on and off the mat. She’s instructed at top studios, companies like Google and Pinterest, and leads the world’s most interactive Online Yoga Teacher Training program. She teaches to a social media following of over 300K people. Her content on Youtube is streamed for 3 million minutes each month. Learn more at BrettLarkin.com

Join Brett’s Online YTT & Continuing Education Programs and receive $100 off tuition and to get my Eat Right for Your Mind Body Type Online Course ($285) FREE. $300 in value: https://www.brettlarkin.com/sahara

item.title: 129: Making Your Dreams Happen with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 129: Making Your Dreams Happen with Sahara Rose
item.description:
So many of us have big dreams but what is the thing that makes some of us achieve it? In this episode, I explain just that. I discuss how we have to take the Vata (idea) into the Pitta (execution) to the Kapha (reevaluation) and how all 3 are essential to making your dreams come true.

If you’re ready to make YOUR dreams happen, come join me on my Abundance Mindset Masterclass where we will break through your money blocks that are holding you back from living a life of freedom, purpose and joy. This is a much-requested class after my abundance podcasts and I’m so excited to be teaching you the very lessons that have totally shifted my life. Chris Harder has to be one of my favorite business coaches out there because he aligns business with giving back. item.description:
This episode is all about behind-the-scenes of my new book and how I traveled around multiple cities around India, meeting up with street photographers I found off Instagram and seeing where the road took me. I ended up in desert villages, ancient homes and even attending my first cremation!

This episode is all about the adventure behind the book-- I can’t wait to share this travel cookbook with you

item.title: 122: Creating White Space with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 122: Creating White Space with Sahara Rose
item.description:
I kind of want to make this caption blank to really drive home what I’m talking about in this episode. This is what we need more of. W h i t e s p a c e. Time to think, breathe, move, reevaluate.

I also share how seated meditation is NOT for everyone and why some of us just can’t seem to do it (hint: it’s because we’re not all supposed to!)

Find your white space. Do it daily.

item.title: 119: Biohacking + Choosing the Best Water with Luke Storey
item.itunes:title: 119: Biohacking + Choosing the Best Water with Luke Storey
item.description:
We have Luke Storey back for part two of his amazing journey—and where he’s at now, 20 years sober!

He is now extremely passionate about health + lifestyle, particularly the modern phenomenon known as “biohacking.”

He explains what biohacking means, the tools and gadgets he uses and we geek out over choosing the best type of water. It is incredible to see Luke’s transformation from listening to both episodes—what a life!

Whether you are a biohacker or not (I personally don’t use tools and gadgets but honor those who do), I love including new perspectives on Highest Self Podcast and this was definitely one of them!

item.title: 118: Overcoming Addiction Holistically with Luke Storey
item.itunes:title: 118: Overcoming Addiction Holistically with Luke Storey
item.description:
If you/ anyone you love has battled with addiction, listen to this episode. Luke Storey suffered from an alcohol, cocaine, heroine and crack addiction for most of his youth. This left him vulnerable, depressed, anxious and lost on his path.

However, through meditation and healthy lifestyle, he has now overcome addictions and is 20 years sober (can you believe he’s in his mid 40’s?! Talk about amazing skin!)

He shares his incredible journey, which inspires all of us that anything is possible through a holistic lifestyle. We have him back on the next episode to share where he is now.

item.title: 115: The Dance Between Doing and Being with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 115: The Dance Between Doing and Being with Sahara Rose
item.description:
I recorded this episode while in Bali, thinking about the juxtaposition between doing and being and how my mind is constantly battling between the two.. and how both are essential for our growth.

The doing creates the momentum—it’s the Pitta, action, fire.

The being allows the insight—it’s the Kapha, rest, Earth.

The Vata is the dance between the two.

item.content:encoded:
I recorded this episode while in Bali, thinking about the juxtaposition between doing and being and how my mind is constantly battling between the two.. and how both are essential for our growth.

The doing creates the momentum—it’s the Pitta, action, fire.

The being allows the insight—it’s the Kapha, rest, Earth.

The Vata is the dance between the two.

Dive into this episode and rethink your relationship with doing and being.

item.itunes:title: 114: Finding Your Dharma with Deepak Chopra
item.description:
This was the most profound interview I’ve ever done, with the person whose inspired me most in life and written the foreword of both of my book. Named Times Magazine “one of the most influential people of the century” with over 85 books, many of which are New York Times Best-Sellers, this man needs no introduction—Deepak Chopra.

We discuss
-how to balance between doing and being
-discovering your dharma
-the meaning of synchronicities
-Deepak’s Dosha
-the importance of grounding and
-the new project Deepak is working on, Inner Space.

I am deeply honored to have him here sharing his wisdom with us.

item.title: 113: Figuring Out Your Dual Dosha with Dr. Suhas Kshirsagar
item.itunes:title: 113: Figuring Out Your Dual Dosha with Dr. Suhas Kshirsagar
item.description:
Dr. Suhas is back for a long-awaited part 2 podcast episode! This time we went deep into the dual Doshas, a topic many of you are confused about, and how to remain balanced when you are a cross in-between.

We also get deep into Jyotish (Vedic) Astrology and how your chart will tell you so much of your health history—including your Dosha! I am always SO honored to have Dr. Suhas, a world renown Ayurvedic Doctor, here with us and am truly blessed to have him as a mentor.

We discuss:
-Balancing dual Doshas (a topic many of you are confused about)
-Jyotish (Vedic) Astrology and how your chart will tell you so much of your health history—including your Dosha
-How your Dosha is related to your Dharma
-This is the long-awaited part 2 podcast interview with my dear mentor Dr. Suhas you’ve been requesting since Episode 51!

item.itunes:title: 110: Deep Dive Into Gut Health with Charity Lighten, Founder of Silver Fern
item.description:
Our gut is the foundation of our health and after my fiancé got Bali Belly and I got Montezuma’s revenge in Mexico, both of us have become probiotic HOUNDS, which led me to discover Silver Fern, an incredible company with extremely high potency probiotics. I was lucky enough to interview the founder on all your digestive questions.

In this episode, we discuss:
-How the digestive system works
-The importance of gut bacteria
-How to heal Candida, leaky gut, SIBO, Crohns
-How to spot a good probiotic
-Do probiotics need to be refrigerated to be effective? (Answer will surprise you!)

item.itunes:title: 108: Making Everyday Your Wedding Day with Sahara Rose
item.description:
I just got engaged and wedding planning is NOT going as expected.. but it’s taught me this important lesson, which I’ll share with you on this episode.

-The realization I had while wedding planning.. and every brides NIGHTMARE that happened to me in Mexico

item.itunes:title: 106: Ayurvedic Herbal Healing with Dr. Virender Sodhi, Youveda Advisory Member
item.description:
I am so privileged to have some of the most educated Ayurvedic doctors on the planet on Highest Self Podcast and Dr. Sodhi is one of them.

Father of Gunny, the founder of Youveda, he is the one that put together the formula of herbs that took his son out a deep, dark depression after the tragic loss of his 16-year-old brother.

Together, this family created Youveda, a company that is changing people’s lives on the daily, with Ayurveda and modern science.

In this episode, we discuss:
-Ayurveda from an herbal perspective
-Balancing your dual Dosha
-Dr. Sodhi’s unique perspective that turmeric should not be heated

item.title: 105: Adapting an Abundance Mindset with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 105: Adapting an Abundance Mindset with Sahara Rose
item.description:
In the spiritual world, we are often afraid about talking about money and say things like “money is the root of all evil” or “money can’t bring happiness.”

In truth, money is ENERGY and it’s only going to be a magnifying glass of who you already are. If you are living in accordance with your truth, more money will allow you to make more impact and live a fuller life.

In this episode I discuss:

-My realization I had in Bali
-Becoming GRATEFUL rather than RESENTFUL of money
-Why changing your abundance mindset is the key to your success
-Dropping the guilt and shame about desiring abundance
-Why making more will allow you to HELP more from a place of empowerment

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 103: Owning Your Wellness Story with Marni Wasserman and Jesse Chappus
item.itunes:title: 103: Owning Your Wellness Story with Marnie Wadderman and Jessie Chappus
item.description:
Have you ever made a major dietary shift but felt afraid to tell your community—especially because you wrote a book about your former way of eating?

That’s what happened to Marni of Ultimate Health Podcast and she had to come clean about her new way of eating, which made her feel better then ever before.

In this episode with her fiance chiropractor Jesse Chappus, we discuss:
-The health + wellness trends the Ultimate Health Podcast Duo has seen
-Why self-care is the new paradigm of wellness
-Their pillars of health
-Coming clean about changing the way you’ve eaten (and promoted)
-Authenticity in the wellness space

In this episode with her fiance chiropractor Jesse Chappus, we discuss: -The health + wellness trends the Ultimate Health Podcast Duo has seen -Why self-care is the new paradigm of wellness -Their pillars of health -Coming clean about changing the way you’ve eaten (and promoted) -Authenticity in the wellness space

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 100: Accessing the Akashic Records with Daniela Gil
item.itunes:title: 100: Accessing the Akashic Records with Daniela Gil
item.description:
Wondering what the Akashic Records even are? The Akashic Records are essentially a dimension where all possibilities exist—all that ever could be.

By tapping in, you receive guidance from ascended masters (who are more like energies, rather than formerly incarnated human-beings) from a broader perspective.

I was trained to become an Akashic Record Practitioner by Daniela after this episode and am so excited to share her wisdom with you.

We discuss:
-What the Akashic Records even are
-How to tap in
-Daniela does a live channeling of the ascended masters from the Akashic plane
-How the Akashic Records is the dimension where all possibilities exist
-My experience being trained by Daniela Gil as an Akashic Records Practitioner

item.title: 099: Why Ayurveda is The Next Big Thing with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 099: Why Ayurveda is The Next Big Thing
item.description:
Ayurveda is going to soon be as popular yoga (mark my words.) In this episode, I discuss WHY becoming an Ayurvedic Practitioner has been so life-changing for me and how you can know if it's right for you.

Receive up to $2250 off tuition off my alma mater Institute for Integrative Nutrition, plus my How To Create a Thriving Business Coach Webinar and other exclusive bonuses by signing up and listing my name as your referral! Launch your new career today: integrativenutrition.com/sahara

They offer two programs: the Masters of Digestion, which focuses on all of the digestive issues from IBS, Crohn’s, candida, leaky gut, et cetera from an Ayurvedic perspective. This is an incredible program if you’re very interested in digestion and want to have a practice helping people with theirs, inclusive of the gut-brain connection, as our mood is a reflection of our digestive health.

Within 1 year, you will be a Certified Ayurvedic Digestion coach and can create your own practices, work with doctors or in wellness centers globally. Digestion is such a hot-topic right now and very few people know about it’s true roots from an Ayurvedic perspective.

The other is their two-year program Fundamentals of Natural Healing Ayurvedic Counselor Program, which trains you to become a Certified Ayurvedic Practitioner (as I am) and work with a wide-range of clients, from nutrition to pregnancy to self-care, or begin your own wellness center!

Within 2 years, you’ll be able to work with any type of client, from those seeking to lose weight, balance anxiety, heal gut issues, address skin problems or launch your own Ayurvedic center, which is SO in demand right now.

As a free gift for all who sign up for Joyful Belly through me, I am additionally offering an exclusive webinar “How To Create a Thriving Business as an Ayurvedic Practitioner” where I teach you how to teach Ayurveda in a world where most have not heard of it, the types of businesses you can create with an Ayurvedic background such as launching your own tea or supplement company, creating a retreat center, online programs and more.

I am also offering an exclusive private Facebook support community where you can connect with other future Ayurvedic practitioners in the tribe.

Click here to learn more and get my bonuses: http://integrativenutrition.com/sahara

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 098: We are the Witches You Tried to Burn with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 098: We are the Witches You Tried to Burn with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Have you ever felt like an outsider, connecting to the magical abilities that exist inside of you and the Earth? Then you are a witch my friend (a good one, of course!)


In this episode I discuss how we are reemerging as the thousands of “witches” once burned at the stake for believing in magic and how it exists more strongly in us than ever before.

-Owning your psychic, supernatural and clairvoyant abilities
-When I was persecuted for being a witch (true story)
-What it means to be a witch
-Embracing the magic that exists within

item.title: 095: The Rise of Women with Danette May
item.itunes:title: 095: The Rise of Women with Danette May
item.description:
There has been a major shift since 2012. We have woken up and realizing that we are all connected. Through supporting one another, we rise.

In this episode, author and public speaker Danette May and I discuss:
-How losing her son and having only $45 to her name was the awakening she needed
-How to become friends with other women, even if you’ve always been a tomboy
-The importance of having a community of sisters and tribe
-How she was an original part of Lori Harder’s mentorship group, which she wrote her book on!

Join Danette May’s Rise event in Colorado Oct 12-14: https://therisedenver.com/

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 094: Why The World Needs More Wellness Warriors with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 094: Why The World Needs More Wellness Warriors with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Have a desire to heal people? Then stop second guessing yourself! This episode is all about OWNING your desire to heal and not waiting until you have some magical diploma that will make you feel like you’re ready to be the healer you already are.

I discuss:

-Why Health Coaches, Ayurvedic Practitioners and Healers are needed more now than ever before

-Why now is the best time to begin your career in the wellness space

-How to stop second-guessing yourself and get over imposter syndrome

-Why it’s time to OWN your desire as the healer you are!

Receive up to $2250 off tuition off my alma mater Institute for Integrative Nutrition, plus my How To Create a Thriving Business Coach Webinar and other exclusive bonuses by signing up and listing my name as your referral! Launch your new career today: integrativenutrition.com/sahara

item.title: 093: Creating an Authentic Brand with Lauryn and Michael of The Skinny Confidential
item.itunes:title: 093: Creating an Authentic Brand with Lauryn and Michael of The Skinny Confidential
item.description:
Social media can be daunting but it’s the most powerful tool we have to share our message, create businesses and connect with others.

In this episode, I sat down with wife and husband duo Lauryn Evarts and Michael Bosstick of The Skinny Confidential to discuss all things working with your partner and building a brand.

We discuss:
-How to balance work and life when working with your partner
-How to authentically show up on Instagram
-Building your personal brand
-Instagram stories—worth it or waste of time?

If you’re interested in building a thriving personal brand, this episode is for you!

Check out Lauryn’s blog theskinnyconfidential.com @theskinnyconfidential.

item.title: 092: Dance Is The Global Language with Vandana Hart
item.itunes:title: 092: Dance Is The Global Language with Vandana Hart
item.description:
Have you watched the new Netflix docuseries, We Speak Dance? I’m OBSESSED and was connected with it’s host and producer, Vandana Hart. We ended up going to a dance hall class together and recording this episode!

In this interview we speak all about:
-How dance is the shared language of the learn
-The healing values of dance
-The cultural differences of dances around the world
-How Vandana created and pitched the show We Speak Dance to Netflix

If you’re a dance lover like me, you’ll adore this episode. Check out the show We Speak Dance on Netflix and connect with Vandana at @vandanahart on Instagram.

item.title: 091: How To Spiritually Grow Through Ease with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 091: How To Spiritually Grow Through Ease with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Have you ever noticed we often hold the belief that in order to grow spiritually we must go through pain? We shape our reality with our thoughts so if we drop those thoughts and choose to grow instead through ease and grace, we open up a whole new paradigm.

-How to choose ease and grace over pain and discomfort
-Why we are attached to our pain stories
-Changing your mindset to one of joy and abundance
-Shifting your reality with your thoughts to open up a whole new paradigm

item.title: 090: Aligning with Success with Aileen of Lavendaire
item.itunes:title: 090: Aligning with Success with Aileen of Lavendaire
item.description:
I was searching one of my favorite words, ikigai (the Japanese term for purpose) on Youtube and I found Aileen’s channel Lavendaire.

We sat down for this interview to discuss:
-How she created a spiritually-focused brand and thriving Youtube channel
-The mindset needed for success
-Balancing spirituality with financial success
-How to be authentic while still having sponsors

item.title: 088: Creating More by Doing Less With Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 088: Creating More by Doing Less With Sahara Rose
item.description:
In my Akashic Record Practitioner Training, I had a realization: that always doing is preventing me from creating my best work. I share this realization and how we have to step into our Kaphas and take a sacred pause in order to allow our best ideas to come through.

I also share with you my new book on Ayurvedic Entrepreneurship and that I'm heading off to Bali to focus on writing it. I hope this episode inspires you to too take that sacred pause and join me for my 30 Day #DoLessCreateMore Challenge.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 087: Opening Wide with Melissa Ambrosini
item.itunes:title: 087: Opening Wide with Melissa Ambrosini
item.description:
We are experiencing a beautiful shift post 2012 back into the Divine Feminine Era and talk about goddesses, moon cycles, feminine archetypes and menstruation is back on the rise. I sat down with best-selling author of Open Wide + Mastering Your Mean Girl, Melissa Ambrosini, to discuss all of these things in a clear way that truly hits home.We are experiencing a beautiful shift post 2012 back into the Divine Feminine Era and talk about goddesses, moon cycles, feminine archetypes and menstruation is back on the rise. I sat down with best-selling author of Open Wide + Mastering Your Mean Girl, Melissa Ambrosini, to discuss all of these things in a clear way that truly hits home.

We discuss:

-The divine feminine archetypes

-How to practice crystal clear communication

-Connecting with our menstrual cycles

-Slipping between our masculine and feminine sides to get stuff done, while being in a receptive mode


I loved this conversation so much, as I’ve been on both overly feminine and masculine sides, and believe it’s so important we speak about polarity to gain balance. 


Check out Melissa’s new book Open Wide, available wherever books are sold.www.Melissaambrosini.com

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

Receive 15% off Four Sigmatic at foursigmatic.com with code "sahara"

item.title: 086: Why Feminine Doesn’t Mean Weak and Masculine Doesn’t Mean Strong with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 086: Why Feminine Doesn’t Mean Weak and Masculine Doesn’t Mean Strong with Sahara Rose
item.description:
As conscious beings, our holds hold power. Let’s change our language from feminine meaning soft and weak, and masculine being strong and assertive and instead use the Doshas to describe qualities to empower both genders.

-How the genderification of characteristics keeps woman playing small and men afraid to be vulnerable
-Why females are not weak but actually the most powerful life-force with warrior-like strength, which would be considered “masculine”
-Durga, the most powerful deity who slays demons, is a female
-Why we should shift the terminology to Vata, Pitta, Kapha rather than masculine and feminine to let genders be as they wish without judgement and labels

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 085: Awakening the Shaman Within with Alyson Charles
item.itunes:title: 085: Awakening the Shaman Within with Alyson Charles
item.description:
Totem animals, sound journeys, medicine bowls.. shamanism seems so interesting but lots of us are confused how it really works. I sat down with my dear friend Alyson Charles to discuss all about what a shaman is, what an awakening moment can look like and how to discover your totem animal.

We discuss:
-Her awakening moment and realization as a shaman
-How to determine your totem animal
-The animal medicine that came out for me that day (I was shocked!)
-Connecting with the spirit realm
-Discovering your truth as a spiritual teacher

If you’re interested in learning more about the shamanic path, this episode is for you.

Connect with Alyson at alysoncharles.com

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 084: How To Meditate (and Stick With it) with Shannon Algeo
item.itunes:title: 084: How To Meditate (and Stick With it) with Shannon Algeo
item.description:
How do you meditate? Like really? Shannon Algeo, meditation expert, breaks it down step-by-step so you can begin a meditation practice (without freaking out.)How do you meditate? Like really? Shannon Algeo, meditation expert, breaks it down step-by-step so you can begin a meditation practice (without freaking out.)

We discuss:

-Why mindfulness matters-Balancing spirituality with activism

-The different types of meditation (moving and still)

-How your life changes with meditation

-How to get your practice started


If you’ve been wanting to get into a meditation practice but are feeling a little intimidated with all the options out there, this is the perfect episode for you.


Connect with Shannon and attend his classes at shannonalgeo.com

item.title: 083: How To Meet The Most Influential People in the World with Alex Banayan
item.itunes:title: 083: How To Meet The Most Influential People in the World with Alex Banayan
item.description:
How can you get connected with the most influential people in the world? Get in through the Third Door. In this inspiring episode, I set with The Third Door author Alex Banayan to discuss how pushed past his boundaries and secured interviews with Bill Gates, Warren Buffet, Larry King, Tim Ferris and many others.

We discuss:
-How he hacked The Price is Right to fund his trip to interview these people
-Choosing your own path vs your parents
-An exact email prompt Tim Ferris gave him for cold-emailing people
-How to beat fear and go after what you want

This interview is all about taking ACTION so if you’re looking for a little inspiration to go after your dreams, listen to this now. Check out Alex’s Book The Third Door, available in bookstores nationwide. Connect with Alex at AlexBanayan.com.

In this episode I share with you how it doesn't exist. Your Dharma is to find it.

item.title: 081: Living a Green Life with Sophie Uliano
item.itunes:title: 081: Living a Green Life with Sophie Uliano
item.description:
Want to live a more plant-based, eco-friendly life but don't know where to start? This episode is for you. I sat down with my dear friend Sophie Uliano, New York Times Best-Selling Author of Gorgeously Green, to discuss all things hormonal balance, adrenal fatigue, plant-based nutrition, sustainable living, green household products, essential oils and more. What I love about Sophie is she makes it fun, relatable and accessible to anyone, making you want to live a more green life from a place of joy, rather than fear. She gives some great tips on how to get started so tune in!

Come join Sophie's Gorgeous for Good Wellness Weekend Retreat in Los Angeles June 9-10 with code "sahara" for 20% off. I'll be there too and can't wait to meet you!

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.description:
We know all about the Doshas but let’s talk about the archetypes! I sat down with Dana James, author of The Archetype Diet, to talk about her 4 archetypes and their similarities/ differences with the Doshas!

We discuss:
-What her 4 archetypes are
-How to find out which you are
-Best foods for each archetype
-How our mind affects the way our body looks
-he cortisol/ belly fat connection and adrenal fatigue\

item.title: 076: How To Be More Confident with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 076: How To Be More Confident with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Confidence is key, but how do we get it? There is so much talk about why confidence is important but the real way to get it is to be in alignment with this..

In this episode I discuss:

What confidence really means
How to exude confidence
The factors behind confidence
How to radiate magnetic success
 

My Doshas + Dharma Program is designed to help you get to the root of what it is you are good at (which is part of your Dosha), that you enjoy (also part of your Dosha), that creates abundance (which is necessary to do it full-time) and the world needs (because we always must give back.)
 
Learn more about my program at
https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/ 
 
We begin on May 28 and I'm happy to answer any questions you have: sahara@eatfeelfresh.com 
 
Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 075: How To Balance Each Dosha with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 075: How To Balance Each Dosha with Sahara Rose
item.description:
This episode is a deep-dive on how to balance each Ayurvedic Dosha and a sample of what my Doshas + Dharma 4 Week Virtual Coaching Program is like. I discuss:

  • What Vatas, Pittas and Kaphas are really good at
  • What they could use a little work on
  • How to balance out the Doshas within you for optimal health, radiant living, inner peace and wild success

Ayurveda is the world's oldest health system and the sister science of yoga. The premise of Ayurveda is that we are each comprised of three Doshas, or energy types. To discover yours, take my free quiz: http://eatfeelfresh.com/new-quiz

My Doshas + Dharma Program is designed to help you get to the root of what it is you are good at (which is part of your Dosha), that you enjoy (also part of your Dosha), that creates abundance (which is necessary to do it full-time) and the world needs (because we always must give back.) 

Learn more about my program at https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/

We begin on May 28 and I'm happy to answer any questions you have: sahara@eatfeelfresh.com

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 074: What's It Like To Be On My Discover Your Dharma- Doshas + Dharma Program
item.itunes:title: 074: What's It Like To Be On My Discover Your Dharma - Doshas + Dharma Program
item.description:
I sat down with three of my former Discover Your Dharma- Doshas + Dharma Program students, now coaches on the program, to ask them what their experience was like. We discuss the blocks they had, what they gained from the program, who they'd recommend it for and what advice they have for other listeners stuck on their journies. They were all listeners of the podcast before joining the program and now in my inner-squad, illustrating the support you get on the program.

Discover your Dharma with my free quiz at https://iamsahararose.com/

We begin May 28th and it lasts 4 weeks.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 072: Creating Your Own Mentorship Tribe with Lori Harder
item.itunes:title: 072: Creating Your Own Mentorship Tribe with Lori Harder
item.description:
I sat down with author Lori Harder for an inside scoop on her recent book launch, "A Tribe Called Bliss," which I highly recommend to ALL women. This episode is real, raw and authentic and you truly are a fly on the wall, listening to two authors talk about the journey it is to get your message out there. We discuss: • Behind-the-scenes of launching a book • How to navigate friendship and social media • The importance of tribe • The power of friends who understand your business • What we can learn from people outside of our business If you're looking to reach the next level of success and know you can't do it all alone, this episode is for you!

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.itunes:title: 071: How Your Dosha is Related to Your Dharma (Life Purpose) with Ayurveda Author Sahara Rose
item.description:
Did you know Vatas are meant to be in the creative fields? And Pittas are meant to be managers? And Kaphas are meant to work one-on-one with people?

This episode is all about my FAVORITE topic—how your Ayurvedic DOSHA (mind-body type) is connected to your DHARMA. My Discover Your Dharma- Doshas + Dharma Program is designed to bring out your life purpose in just four weeks.

Discover your Dharma with my free quiz at https://iamsahararose.com/

In this episode I discuss: -What the Personalities of Each Dosha Are -Each Dosha's Superpower -Finding Yours -How Your Dosha is Related to Your Dharma (Life Purpose)

item.title: 070: The WILD Habits That Will Change Your Life with Tara Mackey
item.itunes:title: 070: The WILD Habits That Will Change Your Life with Tara Mackey
item.description:
In this episode, I sit down with my good friend Tara Mackey, author of Wild Habits and Cured By Nature to discuss how she healed herself from depression, anxiety and a variety of mental "illnesses" (as she had been told) by reconnecting with nature. Her new book shares the WILD Habits that changed her life and she discusses what that acronym stands for in this episode. We discuss: -How Tara got off over a dozen prescription medications and healed herself from depression, anxiety and mental illness with nature -The book writing process -The WILD Habits you need for sustained growth -How to get in touch with your truth

We are also giving away a FREE copy of her book on my Instagram @IAmSaharaRose so check out my post for this episode there to win the giveaway! Pre-order her book and win free bonuses: https://www.wildhabitsbook.com/

Get in touch with Tara at @TaraAMackey and http://theorganiclifeblog.com/

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, I sit down with my good friend Tara Mackey, author of Wild Habits and Cured By Nature to discuss how she healed herself from depression, anxiety and a variety of mental "illnesses" (as she had been told) by reconnecting with nature. Her new book shares the WILD Habits that changed her life and she discusses what that acronym stands for in this episode. We discuss: -How Tara got off over a dozen prescription medications and healed herself from depression, anxiety and mental illness with nature -The book writing process -The WILD Habits you need for sustained growth -How to get in touch with your truth

We are also giving away a FREE copy of her book on my Instagram @IAmSaharaRose so check out my post for this episode there to win the giveaway! Pre-order her book and win free bonuses: https://www.wildhabitsbook.com/

Get in touch with Tara at @TaraAMackey and http://theorganiclifeblog.com/

item.title: 069: The Real Purpose Of Eating Ayurvedically with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 069: The Real Purpose Of Eating Ayurvedically with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Why do we eat Ayurvedically? Why do we take care of our bodies? What is the POINT of all this self-care and wellness rituals? To become your highest self. In this straight-to-the-heart episode, I share my philosophy on how health is not the end-goal but rather a means to the end. That end point is your Dharma-- living out your life purpose. Health matters SO you don't have to worry about your health anymore. Instead, you can use that energy to live out your purpose.

Eating right for your Dosha is just scratching the surface of Ayurveda- it's living according to your Dosha to be in alignment with your Dharma that matters. Join my 4 Week Doshas + Dharma Online Coaching Program to discover your purpose: https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/

item.title: 068: Activating Your Shamanic Roots with Shaman Durek
item.itunes:title: 068: Activating Your Shamanic Roots with Shaman Durek
item.description:
The episode you have been waiting for. I sat down the third-generation Shaman of the 21st century, Shaman Durek to interview him on how we can live our most embodied lives. A spiritual guide and gifted healer, Shaman Durek acts as a mediator or ‘bridge’ between the spiritual and physical planes, applies ancient spiritual wisdom, coupled with decades of devoted study and practice, to help bring success, happiness and healing into people's lives.

After participating in a session with him, we sat down to discuss: -How we can drop the stories and fears keeping us from being our highest selves -Why we are the answers we have been waiting for -Why women empowerment is the key to society empowerment -Why kids see scary visions at night.. and what it means -How to ground down spirituality and practice it in everyday life This is one episode you won't want to miss.

Check out Shaman Durek on Instagram @Shamandurek shamandurek.com and his new podcast Ancient Wisdom Today.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 067: Lessons From 1 Million Downloads with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 067: Lessons From 1 Million Downloads with Sahara Rose
item.description:
On April 7, Highest Self Podcast hit 1 million downloads in it's first 9 months! I never expected this podcast would grow as quickly as it did, but boy does it make me happier that there are SO many other tribe members out there, ready to hear the message of TRUTH! It is 2018 and we are living in the golden age of higher consciousness. We are using social media as a form of higher discussion and our platforms as tools of social change. I created this podcast for this very reason and am so excited to see where it goes in the coming years. In this episode I share: -the lessons I've learned -the episodes that have been most popular -the direction this podcast will take in the coming months -dealing with haters -my insights on being a conscious podcaster

Connect with me on Instagram @IAmSaharaRose to win a free copy of my book, Idiot's Guide to Ayurveda

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 066: Conscious Motherhood, Purpose and Italian Plant-Based Cuisine with Srimati aka Julie Piatt
item.itunes:title: 066: Conscious Motherhood, Purpose and Italian Plant-Based Cuisine with Srimati aka Julie Piatt
item.description:
Whether you are/ want to be a mother or not, this episode is for you. Julie Piatt aka Srimati, wife of vegan athlete extraordinaire Rich Roll, shares with us the art of "unschooling," how to raise your children to foster their own unique identities, rewriting the story of the "helecoptor parent" and her beautiful new cookbook "Plant Power Way: Italia," a vegan Italian cookbook co-written with her husband.

We are doing a giveaway of her book on my Instagram @IAmSaharaRose so check it out over there.

Connect with Julie at srimati.com and pre-order her book here: https://www.amazon.com/Plantpower-Way-Delicious-Recipes-Countryside/dp/0735217599 (out April 24th)

Learn More about my Doshas and Dharma Program: https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/

item.title: 065: Becoming an Ayurvedic Counselor with John Immel of Joyful Belly School of Ayurveda
item.itunes:title: 065: Becoming an Ayurvedic Counselor with John Immel of Joyful Belly School of Ayurveda
item.description:
I’ve partnered up with Joyful Belly School of Ayurvedic Diet & Digestion to offer my Highest Self Podcast Community a $1000 scholarship, a bonus interactive "How to Have a Successful Ayurvedic Practice" webinar with me and support group for their two programs: 1) Masters of Ayurvedic Digestion and Nutrition 500 Hour Certification 2) Fundamentals of Natural Healing - Ayurveda Health Counselor 750 Hour Certification. Click here to receive your discount and learn more: https://www.iamsahararose.com/become-an-ayurveda-counselor

Joyful Belly was the most helpful resource for me while writing my books Idiot’s Guide to Ayurveda and Eat Feel Fresh. While searching high-and-low for an accredited, online Ayurveda certification program with live calls, Joyful Belly came to me like a blessing from the sky. It’s been my go-to source of Ayurvedic wisdom for the past three years and at the forefront of the Ayurveda movement. Just like me, the founder John Immel blends ancient Ayurvedic knowledge with modern nutritional science, making it accessible and relatable for today’s day-and-age. In this episode we speak about everything from: -Understanding your dual-Dosha -The key physical signs of each Dosha -Digestion from an Ayurvedic Perspective -and so much more! Learn more here: https://www.iamsahararose.com/become-an-ayurveda-counselor

Thank you to our sponsor Youveda. Order your month's trial of Ayurvedic herbs for 35% off with code "sahara" at www.youveda.com

item.title: 064: The Art of Mending What's Broken with Author Candice Kumai
item.itunes:title: 064: The Art of Mending What's Broken with Author Candice Kumai
item.description:
When Candice found herself in a deep depression, she went back to retrace her ancestors' roots in Japan to learn the art of kintsugi: to mend what is broken with gold. This inspired her to revisit her life from a new framework: the eyes of the ancient Japanese. Part cookbook, part Japanese philosophy personal development book, Kintsugi teaches you how to embrace your shadows and transmute them into your strengths.

Pre-Order her book Kintusgi: The Japanese Art of Nourishing Mind, Body, and Spirit https://www.amazon.com/Clean-Green-Japanese-Time-Tested-Serenity/dp/0062669850 Connect with Candice at candicekumai.com

Join my Doshas + Dharma Program to find your purpose: https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/

Attend my Ayurveda Workshop in NYC: http://ishtayoga.com/workshops/the-healing-powers-of-ayurveda-with-sahara-rose/

item.content:encoded:
When Candice found herself in a deep depression, she went back to retrace her ancestors' roots in Japan to learn the art of kintsugi: to mend what is broken with gold. This inspired her to revisit her life from a new framework: the eyes of the ancient Japanese. Part cookbook, part Japanese philosophy personal development book, Kintsugi teaches you how to embrace your shadows and transmute them into your strengths.

Pre-Order her book Kintusgi: The Japanese Art of Nourishing Mind, Body, and Spirit https://www.amazon.com/Clean-Green-Japanese-Time-Tested-Serenity/dp/0062669850 Connect with Candice at candicekumai.com

Join my Doshas + Dharma Program to find your purpose: https://eatfeelfresh.lpages.co/doshas-dharma-program/

item.title: 063: Alignment Vs Action: The Path of a Conscious Entrepreneur with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 063: Alignment Vs Action: The Path of a Conscious Entrepreneur with Sahara Rose
item.description:
How can we align our action with our highest truth? This is exactly what I discuss in this episode. We as conscious entrepreneurs must have a good grasp on both alignment and action. If we aren't aligned, we end up chasing a goal that isn't true to us. If we don't take action, we don't move forward and end up stagnant in our careers. Learn more about how to balance both in this episode.

Get the first half of my unreleased book Eat Right For Your Mind-Body Type FREE by emailing a screenshot of your review over to me at sahara@eatfeelfresh.com

item.title: 061: Enhancing Your Mood with Ayurvedic Herbs: Interview with Gunny of Youveda
item.itunes:title: 061: Enhancing Your Mood with Ayurvedic Herbs: Interview with Gunny of Youveda
item.description:
Gunny experienced a tragedy few can even imagine: the loss of his younger brother. After struggling with depression and anxiety, his father, an Ayurvedic physician, told him to change his diet and lifestyle and begin taking certain herbs. Within one month, his mood was totally reversed. Today Gunny has launched Youveda, the first modernized Ayurvedic supplement company that combines herbs with essential vitamins and minerals for mood, digestion, joints and immunity.

As a special offer to Highest Self Podcast listeners, we are offering 35% off one-month supply Youveda formulas with the code "sahara."

We are also giving away three month trials on my Instagram @IAmSaharaRose. If you are interested in Ayurveda, herbology, mental health and healing, this episode is for you. Thank you Gunny of Youveda for being a part of it!

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 060: How To Know The Signs to End Gun Violence with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 060: How To Know The Signs to End Gun Violence with Sahara Rose
item.description:
What can we do to end gun violence? Know the signs. This episode is about how you can look out for signs such as social media declaration, social isolation, violent behavior, video-game addiction, anger, victim-mentality and other warning signals we can look out for to prevent these instances from occurring again. This issue is much larger than just guns-- it's a disconnection from Earth and love. Let's heal this problem holistically, looking at all factors interconnected with violence. Please share this episode, especially with those with kids, so we can protect our children across the country and planet.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.description:

item.title: 058: Journaling To Self Awareness With Katie Dalebout
item.itunes:title: 058: Journaling To Self Awareness With Katie Dalebout
item.description:
I truly believe the best self-help book you can get is a journal. We often have so many peoples voices in our heads that we forget our own truth. In this interview, "Let It Out" author Katie Dalebout shares how to make the most of your journaling experiences, including prompts, practices, and rituals. Katie's book "Let It Out: A Journey Through Journaling" with foreword by Gabby Bernstein (Hay House) offers 55 journaling exercises divided into seven sections covering everything from clearing clutter to finding presence to cultivating abundance to moving beyond fear. Katie is such a sweet soul and you can really feel her warmth and true desire to help people in this interview.

Follow her @katiedalebout. Do you journal? What are your practices?

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 056: The Secret to Doing What You Love That People Don't Talk About with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 056: The Secret to Doing What You Love That People Don't Talk About with Sahara Rose
item.description:
"Do what you love," they say. But they don't tell you the other part-- that a lot of the time you spend doing what you love, you're doing stuff you don't love doing-- and that's normal! This heart-to-heart episode is all about how we ALL have to do things that aren't always fun and joyful to make our dreams come true. Being a conscious entrepreneur is #werk as we create this new paradigm and it's important we know that there WILL be road-blocks so we don't quit when they appear. I'm all about keeping it real with you guys and I think it's important we don't always glamorize the lives of entrepreneurs/ authors/ speakers/ influencers because EVERY job will have things that you don't always want to do. As creators, we must step-up to the plate and take each day by the horns because that's how we get stronger and help more people.

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 055: Shamanic Activation in the Modern Age With My Teacher Malaika of InMyElements
item.itunes:title: 055: Shamanic Activation in the Modern Age With My Teacher Malaika of InMyElements
item.description:
About four years ago, I bought a one-way ticket to Bali with no idea what to expect but knowing I needed a massive change in my life. I wasn't happy with the direction my life was going and knew there was something more to this human experience, but had no idea what that is (listen all about that part of my life in episode 41.) While studying African dance in Ubud, I met a woman named Malaika. I was enamored by her fierce warrior goddess-like energy and her ability to connect the spiritual with the Earth's wisdom. When I found out she had a 5 Elements Shamanic Dance Activation Facilitator Training Certification, I had to sign up. I ended up working for her to pay for some of it because I had no money to my name but I knew I needed to learn from her.

Flash forward four years and everything I had set out for myself has come true, from writing books to being a spiritual teacher. All of this comes back to the foundation work I set in those years, connecting to my body's wisdom and the elements. I am so honored to introduce my teacher, Shaman Malaika Darville, to the Highest Self Podcast. Malaika brings a wealth of earth wisdom having walked the shamanic path for a lifetime.

Across the globe, she is known for her ability to re-connect individuals with their inner body spirituality, helping all who practice with her to access to higher realms of consciousness and authenticity. Committed to personal and planetary awakening, Malaika works with the cardinal directions and elements EARTH, WATER, FIRE and AIR. Malaika founded the 5Elements Dance Activaton™ after receiving the gift of the 5th Element ETHER or SPACE during her yoga teacher training and Ayurvedic studies. Learn more at www.inmyelements.com

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

item.title: 054: How To Balance Your Chakras Through Dance with Sahara Rose
item.itunes:title: 054: How To Balance Your Chakras Through Dance with Sahara Rose
item.description:
Have you ever felt blocked in certain areas of your life, such as your sensuality or ability to express yourself? Then you need to DANCE it out! This episode is all about how you can use different dance forms to balance your various chakras (energy centers in the body.) As a former competitive hip-hop and belly dancer, I truly believe that the body is the root of all emotional imbalances and by moving our bodies in certain ways, we can release traumas, pain, and blockages so our energy can flow freely and we can expand into our highest selves.

We discuss: -The connection between our primal energy + African/ Dance Hall Dance -The connection between our sensual energy + belly dance, salsa, bachata, samba --The connection between our inner power-house + Middle Eastern + Greek line dancing and capoeria -The connection between our ability to give and receive love + Sufi swirling and ballroom dance -The connection between expressing our truth + Native American, Tibetan and Sanskrit chanting -The connection between harnessing our intuition + classical Indian, Balinese and other Asian dance forms -The connection between receiving downloads from the universe + dance meditation Some people/places I discuss: Malaika, my Shamanic and African dance teacher: inmyelements.com Nataraj Dance Festival at Zorba The Buddha in Delhi, India

Intro/ Outro Music: Silent Ganges by Maneesh de Moor

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.

Namaste and happy dancing, Sahara

item.title: 053: How To Complete Everything On Your Bucket List: Interview with Ben Nemtin of The Buried Life
item.itunes:title: 053: How To Complete Everything On Your Bucket List: Interview with Ben Nemtin of The Buried Life
item.description:
What's on your bucket list? Chances are, you haven't really thought about it for a while. But in this episode, you'll see how important it is to have a bucket list AND how to make all your dreams come true. Ben Nemtin is one of the most inspirational people I've met. After dealing with depression, he set out for a trip around the country with his friends to fulfill their bucket-list, just them and their small van. For every wish that they got to fulfill, they would fulfill someone elses. As people heard about their project, it grew and eventually became a show on MTV! In this interview, Ben shares with us how interconnected we all are: how our wishes are not so different from others.

By helping one another, we all rise. Learn more about Ben at bennemtin.com @bennemtin

Check out the Buried Life theburiedlife.com @theburiedlife

Check out the full list: https://www.bennemtin.com/list/

And watch this seriously tear-jerking video about one of the many lives they've touched through this project: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WneGp_1Oy7Y (Seriously this had be bawling tears of joy) Thank you Ben for this incredible interview!

Be part of a community that supports you discovering your dharma in Rose Gold Goddesses, the sacred sisterhood collective with community, content, creativity and so much more — learn more about rosegoldgoddesses.com.
